mhd.documentation: Magnetohydrodynamic activity, description of perturbed fields and profiles using the Generic Grid Description.

mhd.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

mhd.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

mhd.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

mhd.ggd.documentation: Edge plasma quantities represented using the general grid description, for various time slices.

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_r.documentation: R component of the magnetic vector potential, given on various grid subsets

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_r[:].coefficients.documentation: Interpolation coefficients, to be used for a high precision evaluation of the physical quantity with finite elements, provided per element in the grid subset (first dimension).

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_r[:].coefficients_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "coefficients"

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_r[:].grid_index.documentation: Index of the grid used to represent this quantity

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_r[:].grid_subset_inde.documentation: Index of the grid subset the data is provided on

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_r[:].values.documentation: One scalar value is provided per element in the grid subset.

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_r[:].values_error_ind.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "values"

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_tor.documentation: Toroidal component of the magnetic vector potential, given on various grid subsets

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_tor[:].coefficients.documentation: Interpolation coefficients, to be used for a high precision evaluation of the physical quantity with finite elements, provided per element in the grid subset (first dimension).

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_tor[:].coefficients_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "coefficients"

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_tor[:].grid_index.documentation: Index of the grid used to represent this quantity

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_tor[:].grid_subset_in.documentation: Index of the grid subset the data is provided on

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_tor[:].values.documentation: One scalar value is provided per element in the grid subset.

mhd.ggd[:].a_field_tor[:].values_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "values"

mhd.grid_ggd.documentation: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebase

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].base.documentation: Set of bases for the grid subset. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid.

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].base[:].j.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].base[:].t.documentation: Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_covariant"

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].dimension.documentation: Space dimension of the grid subset elements. This must be equal to the sum of the dimensions of the individual objects forming the element.

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].element.documentation: Set of elements defining the grid subset. An element is defined by a combination of objects from potentially all spaces

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].element[:.documentation: Set of objects defining the element
Index of the space from which that object is taken

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].identifie.documentation:
Grid subset identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) nodes : All nodes belonging to the associated spaces
2) faces : All faces belonging to the associated spaces
3) x_aligned_faces : All x-aligned (poloidally) aligned faces belonging to the associated spaces
4) y_aligned_faces : All y-aligned (radially) aligned faces belonging to the associated spaces
5) cells : All cells belonging to the associated spaces
6) x_points : Nodes defining x-points
7) core_cut : y-aligned faces inside the separatrix connecting to the active x-point
8) PFR_cut : y-aligned faces in the private flux region connecting to the active x-point
9) outer_throat : y-aligned faces in the outer SOL connecting to the active x-point
10) inner_throat : y-aligned faces in the inner SOL connecting to the active x-point
11) outer_midplane : y-aligned faces connecting to the node closest to outer midplane on the separatrix
12) inner_midplane : y-aligned faces connecting to the node closest to inner midplane on the separatrix
13) outer_target : y-aligned faces defining the outer target
14) inner_target : y-aligned faces defining the inner target
15) core_boundary : Innermost x-aligned faces
16) separatrix : x-aligned faces defining the active separatrix
17) main_chamber_wall : x-aligned faces defining main chamber wall outside of the divertor regions
18) outer_baffle : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the outer active divertor region
19) inner_baffle : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the inner active divertor region
20) outer_PFR_wall : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the outer active divertor region
21) inner_PFR_wall : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the inner active divertor region
22) core : Cells inside the active separatrix
23) sol : Cells defining the main SOL outside of the divertor regions
24) outer_divertor : Cells defining the outer divertor region
25) inner_divertor : Cells defining the inner divertor region
26) core_sol : x-aligned faces defining part of active separatrix separating core and sol
27) full_main_chamber_wall : main_chamber_wall + outer_baffle(s) + inner_baffle(s)
28) full_PFR_wall : outer_PFR__wall(s) + inner_PFR_wall(s)
29) core_cut_X2 : y-aligned faces inside the separatrix connecting to the non-active x-point
30) PFR_cut_X2 : y-aligned faces in the private flux region connecting to the non-active x-point
31) outer_throat_X2 : y-aligned faces in the outer SOL connecting to the non-active x-point
32) inner_throat_X2 : y-aligned faces in the inner SOL connecting to the non-active x-point
33) separatrix_2 : x-aligned faces defining the non-active separatrix
34) outer_baffle_2 : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the outer non-active divertor region
35) inner_baffle_2 : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the inner non-active divertor region
36) outer_PFR_wall_2 : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the outer non-active divertor region
37) inner_PFR_wall_2 : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the inner non-active divertor region
38) intra_sep : Cells between the two separatrices
101) outer_mid_plane_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at outer mid-plane
102) inner_mid_plane_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at inner mid-plane
103) outer_target_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at outer active target
104) inner_target_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at inner active target
105) outer_target_separatrix_2 : Point on non-active separatrix at outer non-active target
106) inner_target_separatrix_2 : Point on non-active separatrix at inner non-active target
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].metric.documentation: Metric of the canonical frame onto Cartesian coordinates

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].metric.ja.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"

mhd.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:].metric.te.documentation: Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_covariant"

mhd.grid_ggd[:].identifier.documentation:
Grid identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) linear : Linear
2) cylinder : Cylinder
3) limiter : Limiter
4) SN : Single null
5) CDN : Connected double null
6) DDN_bottom : Disconnected double null with inner X-point below the midplane
7) DDN_top : Disconnected double null with inner X-point above the midplane
8) annulus : Annular domain

mhd.grid_ggd[:].identifier.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

mhd.grid_ggd[:].space[:].coordinates_typ.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therfore defines the dimension of the space. The meaning of these predefined integer constants can be found in the documentation of the grid service library

mhd.grid_ggd[:].space[:].geometry_type.i.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

mhd.grid_ggd[:].space[:].identifier.documentation:
Space identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) primary_standard : Primary space defining the standard grid
2) primary_staggered : Primary space defining a grid staggered with respect to the primary standard space

mhd.grid_ggd[:].space[:].identifier.inde.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

mhd.grid_ggd[:].space[:].objects_per_dim.documentation: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described.
Set of objects for a given dimension
Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object
List of indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object. An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on a boundary
Geometry data associated with the object. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered.
Index in the error_description list for "geometry"
Measure of the space object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...)
Index in the error_description list for "measure"
List of nodes forming this object (indices to objects_per_dimension(1)%object(:) in Fortran notation)

mhd.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

mhd.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

mhd.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

mhd.ids_properties.homogeneous_time.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0 or 1) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, this node must still be filled, and set to 1 (by convention).

mhd.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

mhd.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)
